data.title: key shortcuts becomes unbound or complicated when input method changes

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
Key shortcuts change when input method changes

- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Change input method to English
2. Open Visual Studio Code
3. Key shortcuts is bound, e.g. terminal is bound to `` ^` ``
4. Change input method to Chewing
5. Some key shortcuts becomes unbound, e.g. Toggle Terminal, or very complicated, e.g. Go to File

![2017-06-15 10 45 07](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2316687/27163167-216f63fa-51b8-11e7-9e3e-ff6073167e00.png)

data.title: Find + Go to line messes up editor layout
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.14.0-insider (fda3ed38449fea27b97698ad0950c2870bf6afaa, 2017-06-14T05:13:12.994Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: (ran as `code-insiders --disable-extensions -n` and confirmed that the extensions were not loaded)

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.11.4|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|1.3.2|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Ctrl+N, add some lines
2. Ctrl+F (don't need to actually search for anything but leave the find box open)
3. Ctrl+G and type a line number (pressing enter is optional to see the bug)
4. Observe that a blank space is added at the top of the editor (it scrolls out of view if you have enough lines to scroll; closing the find box gets rid of this space)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/494055/27161390-fb8ef8c2-512f-11e7-83a2-d775a8f09cd6.png)

data.title: Git diff view gets stuck on previous diff
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Not sure if related or required, but follow steps to replicate #28761
2. With the bugged/opened diff view still open, make and save another change to the same file
3. Click on the change again in Source Control: it should still show the previous diff

The only way to correct this is to manually close the stale diff and click on the change again.

data.title: Git Working Tree diff view becomes open editor without making changes in it
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a source controlled file, make changes and save
2. Click open the diff view in Source Control, then commit it
3. Return to the editor pane (note: the Working Tree/Index tab remains available in view mode (?))
4. Make a change and save it

The Working Tree view tab at this point changes to an open editor tab.

data.title: Vertical Selection via Alt + {Mouse Select}
data.body:
**Feature Request**: As in Visual Studio, one can select and edit columns via Holding down the <kbd>Alt</kbd> key and pressing the mouse button while moving in a vertical fashion. 

The user can replace vertically as well as delete or add new items within the selection after the selection has been made.  

 Very handy.

![verticaledit](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1110966/27159725-8601413a-512c-11e7-85d6-fdb082e53e2c.gif)

data.title: Integrated terminal text floats above panel tabs when terminal font is configured in settings
data.body:
Udated to 1.13 and now my PowerShell Integrated Console is unusable. The prompt is above the Problems, Output, Debug Console, Terminal menu bar and those options are no longer clickable.

- VSCode Version: 1.13
- OS Version: Win10 14393

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Load Visual Studio Code, PowerShell Integrated Console autoloads

![vscode_1 13_issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4750977/27158435-ebf007e4-5134-11e7-89b9-4742a2b329ab.jpg)

Update: I removed the custom "terminal.integrated.fontFamily": "", setting I had been using and this appears to resolves the issue. I had been running with that setting for most of the day, until the update.

data.title: Cannot Get JSDoc React Component Summary in Intellisense
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.13.1 (1.13.1) - OS Version: 10.12.5 (16F73) Steps to Reproduce: 1. Clone https://github.com/ambroselittle/vscode-intellisense-issue 2. Open repo folder in Code. 3. Open src/App.tsx. 4. Hover over the imported TestComponent and/or try typing to add a new one. Actual: Just shows 'import ComponentName'. (This is true on my actual project as well, not just this simple repro.) Note that property docs work as expected: I've done my best to follow [the docs](https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/wiki/JavaScript-Language-Service-in-Visual-Studio#JsDoc), and I reviewed the [JSDoc support](https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/wiki/JsDoc-support-in-JavaScript). That last isn't very clear on if it's supported but seems to imply that just adding the `/** Some summary doc. */` should work, as I've done in the repro. Consider this a feature request if it's not implemented or tell me which to vote up, please. I really would like to provide some doc guidance for the shared components we have and have it show up there. Related: it'd be awesome to surface the specific JSX properties I specify at the top of the list so it's more obvious what the props are, not to mention showing right after `

data.title: window.openFilesInNewWindow ... on/off/default ... not on/off
data.body:
The announcement seems off on `window.openFilesInNewWindow` ...

![capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1622880/27156855-a03193c8-5124-11e7-8a31-87442d9d88ec.PNG)

![capture1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1622880/27156866-a2c03464-5124-11e7-9678-8333ad54b424.PNG)

Also to clarify the behavior of the command: This doesn't quite do what I was hoping. When I open one file and without modifying that file open a new file, the new file isn't opening in a new window. It's still replacing the file I initially opened.

It's a bit of a pain-point for me. When working on a docs, I often need to open a doc ... leave it open there on a tab ... click on a different doc to open it (on a hopefully new tab) ... then go back to the first one (that I wish was still open). That's not the behavior: If I don't make a change to the initial file, it opens the new file *in the same tab* replacing what I was just looking at. Please let me know if I'm doing something wrong ... it wouldn't surprise me if I just didn't know how to configure the IDE for the behavior I'm hoping to have.

data.title: File descriptors leak causes system to crash
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.0 (376c52b955428d205459bea6619fc161fc8faacf, 2017-06-08T16:34:53.678Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|jshint|dbaeumer|0.10.15|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.11|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|3.1.3|
|darcula-extended|smlombardi|3.3.2|
|vscode-open-in-github|sysoev|1.6.0|
|gitblame|waderyan|1.11.2|
|Material-theme|zhuangtongfa|2.8.6|;


---
I have a project with a lot of npm dependencies. I also run an ember-cli server and a react server. After couple minutes of usage, my OS ran out of file descriptors and nothing works anymore. When I look at the number of open files per process, VSCode is always at the top of the list and shows 8000+ open files. As soon I quit VSCode, everything is back to normal.

This is not something progressive where I would see the number of open file going up slowly. VSCode is pretty stable until I am suddenly put of file descriptors.

I haven't found yet what steps causes it but it occurs all the time! That issue started to show up in the past week or two.

data.title: Markdown previews not working / Electron; getOwnerBrowserWindow errors
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.14.0-insider (fda3ed38449fea27b97698ad0950c2870bf6afaa, 2017-06-14T05:13:12.994Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: none
---

# Steps to Reproduce:

These were from a clean install of VSCode Insiders. I do not have any extensions installed, as I thought maybe they were causing it. But after uninstalling and removing any extensions I have, the previews continued to not work and these errors continued to show up.

1. Open Help > Release Notes; or Any markdown file preview; or any Extension Details.
2. Markdown will not display.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2145187/27155192-3aa804a6-5115-11e7-9af6-ba32550db714.png)

Sidebar content not loading as a result, have to close and reopen sidebar multiple times before anything is displayed in the sidebar.

## Additional getOwnerBrowserWindow errors:

1. With any markdown preview open.
2. Close or resize the side bar.

data.title: Highlight this in Monokai
data.body: Fixes #28682

data.title: Font scale/blurriness after connecting external display
data.body:
Environment:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 Pro on MacBook Pro
- Native resolution: 2880 x 1880
- Windows DPI scaling: 125% (with "Let me choose one size for all my displays" ticked)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. VS code running on laptop screen: Text looks crisp
2. Plug in external monitor (2560 x 1440)
3. VS Code moves to external monitor display
4. Font display in VS Code becomes blurry / pixelated

Work-around:
 * Restart VS Code, and correct font-rendering is restored.

data.title: Integrated Terminal: Multiline Urls are not handled correctly

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:
Version 1.13.0 (1.13.0)
- OS Version:
OSX - Sierra
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open vscode integrated terminal
2. Produce an URL which has a line-break inside the console (this for example could be the output of git push with the merge-request creation link, but you can simulate it by just typing an URL basically, has the same effect)
3. Try to click on it with CMD+Click

- Expected result:

Full URL is parsed correctly

- Actual result:

Only the part, which is on the 1. line is parsed as the URL

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14992140/27153633-7d813a26-5152-11e7-8cda-b86ec1c072f3.png)

NOTE: In iTerm its working as expected

![bildschirmfoto 2017-06-14 um 22 41 35](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14992140/27153679-af4bb7fc-5152-11e7-8a0d-9ff31a96a068.png)

data.title: Javascript Intellisense can't find function declaration.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: Windows 7

```js
var $tw = {}
$tw.boot = {};
$tw.boot.test = function(){
    console.log('hello world');
}
$tw.boot.test();
```

Take this javascript code and open it in VS Code. Then place your cursor on the call to `$tw.boot.test()` and press F12. No definition is found.

data.title: Feature Request: Add Setting to toggle Diff Editor vertical wrapping when navigating to Next Change

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open one of the files in the Diff Editor
2. Use the Next Change UI buttons (or the `workbench.action.compareEditor.nextChange` keyboard shortcut) to jump through all changes in the file.
3. After viewing the last change in the file, hit the Next Change button again.

Currently the diff editor will loop back to the first diff in the file. It would be nice to have a Setting added to stop this from looping and instead have the UI button grey out (and keyboard shortcut do nothing).

This would be useful as I often find myself re-reviewing changes that I've already looked at, not realizing that the diff editor wrapped back around to the first diff in the file, especially in files with lots of diffs. By having it not wrap, I don't have to waste time trying to determine if the diff viewer wrapped or not, and I can be confident that I have viewed all diffs in the file.

data.title: Multiple inline events on one element results in "Unreachable Code Detected" error
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: Win 10 Pro

If there are more than one inline events (such as "onclick") on one element, and one ends in something besides a function call (e.g. "return false;"), the next one will be flagged with "Unreachable code detected."

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create an HTML file where one tag has multiple "on..." events, where the first one is "return false;"
```
<!doctype html>
<html lang="en">
<head></head>
<body>
    <div onclick="return false;" ondragstart="return false;">
</body>
</html>
```
2. You will see the second "return" (in ondragstart) underlined in red, and "Unreachable code detected" under problems.

If there are many events, this only happens for the event following the first one that does not end in a function call, and happens regardless of the other code for either event.
So here "bar" is underlined:
`    <div onclick="foo(); return false;" ondragstart="bar();">`
Here "bar" is underlined but "foobar" is not:
`    <div onclick="foo(); return false;" ondragstart="bar(); return false;" onkeydown="foobar();">`
Here "foobar" alone is underlined:
`<div onclick="foo();" ondragstart="bar(); return false;" onkeydown="foobar();">`

data.title: Cmd + p in settings.json should stay focused in the editor
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.13.0 (1.13.0) - edited
OS: Mac OSX 10.11.6 (15G1421)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In `settings.json` pressing <kbd>cmd + p</kbd> and then <kbd>escape</kbd>/<kbd>⎋</kbd> will focus the cursor in the `Search Settings` bar.
![jun-08-2017 15-37-01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3750409/26953866-c617ff04-4c61-11e7-9cc4-b1764ff917f4.gif)

Expected:
Focus back in the settings file on the right.

PS: I'm using a screen cap from another issue but if you follow the steps above the same behavior occurs.

data.title: __restart object is not returned to debug adapters with requested data
data.body:
From https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/26315#issuecomment-308519378

When a debug adapter sends `this.sendEvent(new TerminatedEvent({ port: this._port }));`, the expected `__restart` property is not set on the new launch config.

Only reproes in Insiders

data.title: Allow changing the background colour in StatusBarItem
data.body: Allowing extensions to set the background colour would be useful for things like mode changes in the Vim plugin (https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/issues/1839)

data.title: 点击集成终端内的链接（有换行时），跳转地址错误
data.body:
@rebornix 
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.14.0-insider (fda3ed38449fea27b97698ad0950c2870bf6afaa, 2017-06-14T05:13:12.994Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.16215
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|npm-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.3.0|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.4.2|

Steps to Reproduce:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13050025/27147739-71b3328a-5170-11e7-988b-92f0337034a8.png)
